channel.title: Laptop doesn't start up
channel.description: so i kindof bitch slapped my laptop pretty hard, then i got blue screen so i rebooted but after windows loading screen i always got bsod :l i tried system recovery, startup repair etc didn't work at all. so i tried to reinstall windows 7. installation was running fine but after the install it was checking my hdd for errors wich took like 3 days to complete (wtf lol) and now when i startup, it just freezes at bios :l maybe hardware error? anyone know whats going on?

item.title: Laptop doesn't start up
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Happened to me as well with my Acer. It was a hardware failure, it was going to be a costly fix so I just got a new laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop doesn't start up
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I suspect its to hardware failure too. I’d reccomend salvaging the parts that work or sell it someone who knows nothing about laptops haha. Its easy to make somebody think their getting a deal when they know nothing about it lol

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop doesn't start up
item.dc:creator: @Squirt_Ltd Squirt Ltd
item.description:
@Squirt_Ltd wrote:

[quote=“Alec_, post:1, topic:446120”]Could be harddrive failure. Contact whatever company made the computer and ask them about a repair. If you’re not under warranty it could be costly :/.

[size=1pt]next time don’t bitch slap your laptop[/size][/quote]

Damnlol thanks 4 your help

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop doesn't start up

item.description:

so i kindof bitch slapped my laptop pretty hard, then i got blue screen so i rebooted but after windows loading screen i always got bsod :l i tried system recovery, startup repair etc didn’t work at all. so i tried to reinstall windows 7. installation was running fine but after the install it was checking my hdd for errors wich took like 3 days to complete (wtf lol) and now when i startup, it just freezes at bios :l maybe hardware error? anyone know whats going on?
